50 days until 5 Lakes Lodge on Gullrock is home for 7 days. Just went on a short trip to Basspro to ease the pain of waiting. Never can have to much in the ol' tackle box.

Dogtooth Lake. June 1st through the 8th. 44 days, 16 hours, and 9 minutes till we leave. I have a countdown timer that I use on my computer that I reset the day after we get back. It lets me know how many (long) days until the next fishing vacation with the guys.
I need one of those!
Do a Google Search for one. That is how I came across it. :)

104 days for our group and it has been 10 years since I have been to CANADA!! Works screws up so many great fishing trips. Or maybe it was my 4 daughters and Ballgames and ballgames and did I mention ballgames. But so worthwhile. I asked them if they wanted to go and they looked at me. a week on an island, no stores no resturaunts, no TV NO PHONES!!!!! NO WAY!! I hope someday they will join me and go and enjoy the unbelievable Peace and fellowship sounds smells, sunsets, meals cold ones and on and on. Make Mine a Jig and pass me a cold Busch Light thats right Busch Light
we are into the teens! I am like a dog getting his belly scratched and my hind leg is shaking uncontrollably Trout lake here we come
I can't wait!!!! 23 days, 15 hours, 44 minutes, and 47 seconds.

54 and a wake up till Dogtooth Lake.

Past two years I'm on a hog slump, however the volume has been nothing short of spectacular. I've had a couple big girls on but haven't put them in the boat. 07 is the year to get back in the hog saddle. 107 days!

NE Piker: Congrats on your son's graduation, med school is a long, tough hike. My wife of 20 years will graduate this Aug with her PhD in audiology, so I have had my taste of what that is like. Good luck in Texas and enjoy the time, but like you said, nothing beats NWO and Lac Seul. This year my son is going, taking his sister's place (we alternate), so he is eager to show the old man how to catch fish. Willams Wanne-Be Last year was not the best year for us in the big fish category at LS, with the biggest in the boat for the week was a 29" walleye, which is still a darn good fish. From everything I have read, that year class of fish which had the big mommas of 30"+ is coming to an end. What is really fun is that the class of fish that is 24 - 25" right now appears to be huge. That is not to say they will be at the 30" length this year or even next as the growth rate is pretty slow in LS comparaed to warmer waters back in the US. However, what is wrong with catching 100+ walleyes a day where 50% are in that range. Also take into consideration that we now we spend at least two half days targetng smallies, which we never did a few years ago. The smallies have really come on both in numbers and size. As much as I love walleyes, there is something about a smallie blowing up a top-water bait that is awesome! Last year, during one evening fishing, I was throwing a top-water for bass on 6 lb line, when a 40" northern blew it up. Had it on for a few minutes before the line popped, but that was blast. The big fish are there, but I suspect in slightly fewer numbers that perhaps a couple of years ago. However, with that said, I can go a year in WI and IA and not put a 27" walleye in the boat (other than from Lake Michigan) so LS remains a great lake for both numbers and size. Cheers,,,,IA Walleye

109 days to Silver Water Wheel Lodge and Lac Seul walleye. However I'm not counting at all.

Hey JackSalmon-I found a map at home. Actually, it is one that Wisconeye set me up with a couple years ago. If you'd like a copy (and you do) shoot me an email at [email protected] and I'll mail it to you.

134 days till the Hells Anchors hit the Gouin. Can't wait. Is there anything better in this 'ol world than to be walleye fishing for a week with your best buddies on a remote lake in Canada??? ICY Canadian Beer, BBQ's and that priceless span of days when time has no meaning and no bearing on what you do or when you do it. Freedom...

Jigger 1: Looks like your at SWWL the week after our trip. All of NWO is great, but it really does not get much better than SWWL and LS. Like you, I know the precise number of days, but who is counting :) IA Walleye

110 days till I hit Big Vermilion, Little Vermilion and Lac Seul for 5 days, then off to the cabin on Kawaweogama for 22 days. Cannot come soon enough.

IA Walleye and Jigger 1 have probably seen a similar number of big walleye in the boat. They do not likely know each other but both have a very intense fishing style, and are good fisherman. Did you guys get any hogs last year?

Iowa Walleye I am getting the itch. My son and I are headed to Lake Fork in Northeast Texas week of March 18th to humor me on some fine bass fishing, but Lac Seul is where my heart will be. We will be at Mahkwa Lodge the last few days of May into the first couple of days of June. My oldest son graduates from Medical School in May, so this will be a real celebration trip. Best wishes!! NE Piker
94 days for our group. Once it's under 100, you're almost there ;-)
July trip to LOTW and two August trips to Separation Lake. Walleyes, cold Labatts Blue, Cuestra Rey Centro Fino cigars and good company around the campfire. Can't wait!!
June 13 to Lac Seul..77-year old father and 14-year old son, 3 generations of bad fisherman....priceless! IA Walleye

june 2 lotw snake bay..1 generation of 3 bad fisherman..horn dog, bobba bouy, and hubba bubba..actually we do pretty well as i keep the group sain..white pine lodge sioux falls.. hope the crappies are off the dock in the evening like last year. pretty sure we will do ash rapids lodge kenora area with the wife and kids 1st week of sept..little hint of spring in chicago today, and days are getting longer...think ill have a blue and daydream...bender gone..somebody else do the counting
107 days before heading to Mattice Lake Outfitters --- flying to Ogoki Res! Countin' 'em down!
80. I will have a Molson and daydream as well.
Hey JackSalmon-been there before? I was there the last two years, if you want me to mark up some maps for you, I'd be happy to do it.

Jigman, this is our first trip there --- first trip with Mattice Lake. My son is graduating HS in May and this is his graduation present. We would be extremely appreciative if you would mark a map for us! Now, how to get the map? Anyway, thanks a million!

Jack- I may still have one lying around. If not, all you have to do is ask Don for one and they'll mail one to you. It may be available on their website, I'll check. If it is, I'll download and mark it up. You are going to love MLO and the Ogoki. I'll tell you this, bring LOTS of 1/4 and 3/8 oz. jigs. I mean LOTS, did I mention to bring LOTS of jigs? There is a map at MLO's website, but it is only a 8.5"x11". If you ask Don to mail you one, it will be a bigger map. Let me check at home for a copy first, if I don't have one, I'll let you know. You can contact Don and ask for one then.
ask.com is where i printed off maps of wabakimi lake. aug. 7th for my group-152 days

August 4th for us and the last week in September. I have been sending digital pictures to the guys for the last week or two. One had a picture of the dock where my buddy docks his boat when he was out fishing. It just had his bumpers and ropes there. I titled the picture "What is missing from the picture, your Lund" He then send me a picture of the fish fry on one of our nights there. Pretty much shoots the productivity for the day.
